properties.NAME: Changi Beach Massacre
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Changi Beach was a massacre site of Sook Ching. The Hojo Kempei (Japanese auxiliary military police) machine-gunned many male civilians on this shore on 20 February 1942.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Changi Beach Park Lamp Post A2-13 (113), Near Car Park 2

properties.NAME: Trinity Theological College
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Trinity Theological College was born out of the camaraderie and spirit of Christianity experienced by the heads of the Anglican, Methodist and Presbyterian Churches when they were interned at Changi Prison during the Japanese Occupation. Founded on 4th O

properties.NAME: Chui Eng Free School
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Chui Eng Free School was established here in 1854 by the Singapore Hokkien Huay Kuan. It was the second-oldest private Chinese school and also one of the first free educational institutions in Singapore.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Far East Square

properties.NAME: Sentosa Beach
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Surrendered British Gunners awaiting Japanese internment buried some 300 bullet-ridden corpses washed ashore on Pulau Blakang Mati, now known as Sentosa.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Former Berhala Reping Artillery Post, Serapong Course Road, Course 4, Sentosa Golf Club

properties.NAME: Gan Eng Seng School
properties.DESCRIPTIO: In 1885, Gan Eng Seng founded a free school for poor boys in Singapore. Initially named the Anglo-Chinese Free School, it was among the earliest schools to offer a bilingual education. The school moved to its first new building about 50 metres behind Tel
properties.ADDRESSSTR: Junction of Telok Ayer Street and Cecil Street
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Landscape Plaza

properties.NAME: Raffles Institution
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The first school in Singapore, it was founded by Sir Stamford Raffles on 5 June 1823. It was originallly known as ite&w=193
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of North Bridge Road and Stamford Road, beside Raffles City

properties.NAME: Sri Krishnan Temple
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This temple was built in 1870 and is one of the oldest Hindu temples in Singapore.

properties.NAME: Pulau Sejahat
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Pulau Sejahat was designated as a British defence outpost. The military encampment on the island included gun emplacements, water tanks and observation towers.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Changi Beach Park Lamp Post A2-13 (113), near Car Park 2

properties.NAME: Kwan Im Thong Hood Cho Temple
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This temple was built in 1884, showcasing a fine example of Chinese temple architecture and traditional craftsmanship. The temple played an important role in providing refuge for the sick, the wounded and the homeless during the Japanese Occupation.

properties.NAME: Outram Road Prison
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Outram Road Prison was the main jail in Singapore until Changi Prison opened in 1937. Thereafter, it became a remand prison, housing opium addicts, juvenile delinquents, and political detainees.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Outram Park MRT Station, Exit B

properties.NAME: Batu Berlayar
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Batu Berlayar (gov.sg/places/historic-sites/batu-berlayar
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Batu Berlayar Point, near Car Park B, Labrador Nature Reserve

properties.NAME: Tan Tock Seng Hospital
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This hospital was founded in 1844 by Tan Tock Seng, a philanthropic Hokkien Chinese pioneer, for the poor and destitute. Here, several firsts in Singapore's medical history were achieved.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Sinaran Drive entrance of Tan Tock Seng Hospital

properties.NAME: Geylang Serai
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Geylang Serai is a social centre for the Malay community in Singapore. It was originally filled with lemongrass (193
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Main entrance of Geylanf Serai Market and Food Centre

properties.NAME: Changi Murals
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The Changi Murals was a symbol of hope and faith for prisoners during the Japanese Occupation. It depicted scenes from the Bible, and were painted by Stanley Warren, a Prisoner-of-War.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Side Entrance of Changi Museum

properties.NAME: Republic of Singapore Yacht Club
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Founded in 1826, this club became the Royal Singapore Yacht Club in 1922 under the patronage of the Prince of Wales, and was renamed the Republic of Singapore Yacht Club in 1967 with the first president of Singapore, Yusof bin Ishak as it patrons.

properties.NAME: Pondok Peranakan Gelam Club
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Singaporew.nhb.gov.sg/places/historic-sites/pondok-peranakan-gelam-club

properties.NAME: Middle Road Church
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Built between 1870-75, the Middle Road Church was first known as the Christian Institute. When it was officially inaugurated as the Malay Church in 1894, it became the first Straits Chinese Methodist Church in Singapore.

properties.NAME: The Founding of Boys' Brigade in Singapore
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Singaporew.nhb.gov.sg/places/historic-sites/the-founding-of-boys-brigade-in-singapore
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Prinsep Street Presbyterian Church

properties.NAME: Syonan Jinja
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Syonan Jinja was built in 1942 in memory of the Japanese soldiers who died fighting in the invasion of Singapore. Ceremonies for significant events were held here until it was destroyed after the war.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction between Adam Road and Sime Road, near Bus Stop No. 41141

properties.NAME: Ee Hoe Hean Club
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Founded in 1895, it is one of the oldest millionaires club in Singapore. The club was the centre of the Chinese Salvation Movement in Southeast Asia from 1937-1942. Originally located at Duxton Hill, it moved to Club Street before settling at this locati

properties.NAME: Farrer Park
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Farrer Park was the site of the first race course in Singapore, and continued to be a venue for numerous sporting events. It was a site for political gatherings and demonstrations in the 1940s and 1950s.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Walkway to Block 11, Gloucester Road, near Farrer Park MRT Station Exit D

properties.NAME: Singapore Chin Kang Huay Kuan
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Established in 1918 by Chinese Immigrants from the Jin Jiang County of southern Fujian Province, it was the headquarters of the Overseas Chinese Mobilisation Council, formed in 1941 to help Singapore50s.

properties.NAME: Kandang Kerbau Hospital
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Kandang Kerbau Hospital, the birthplace of over 1.2 million Singaporeans, was the largest maternity hospital in the world from the early 1950s to the early 1970s. It was named after the district where it was located. The district around the crossroads fo
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Bukit Timah Road and Tekka Lane

properties.NAME: Alexandra Hospital
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Alexandra Hospital opened in 1940 for British troops stationed in Singapore. On 14 and 15 February 1942, it was assaulted by invading Japanese troops, who killed about 200 patients and medical staff.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Garden Valley at Alexandra Hospital

properties.NAME: Sri Senpaga Vinayagar Temple
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This temple was built by Ceylon Tamils. It began in an attap shed under a champak (gar-srisenpaga-vinayagar-temple.jpg?bc=white&w=193

properties.NAME: Queenstown
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Queenstown was built in 1960s to meet housing shortage in Singapore after the Second World War. It is Singaporeple.jpg?bc=white&w=193

properties.NAME: Kranji Beach Battle
properties.DESCRIPTIO: It was here on 9 February 1942 that the Japanese forces suffered a major loss, fighting against the valiant 27th Australian Brigade and the Dalforce.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Kranji Reservoir Park, Kranji Way, near Pavilion area

properties.NAME: Pasir Panjang Battle
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The Battle for Pasir Panjang, where the harbour and British military depots were the coveted gains, marked one of the last battles for Singapore. It lasted from 12 to 14 February 1942.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Kent Ridge Park, beside Car Park B

properties.NAME: Labrador Battery
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This is one of the surviving gun emplacements in Singapore today. The battery has two 6brador-battery.jpg?bc=white&w=193
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Near History Walk, Labrador Nature Reserve

properties.NAME: Bukit Batok Memorials
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Two memorials, one for the Japanese soldiers and the other for Allied Soldiers sat on top on this hill-top. The former was Syonan Chureito, built by 500 Allied Prisoners of War while the latter was a wooden cross that stood behind. The Japanese demolishe
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Bukit Batok Nature Park

properties.NAME: Sook Ching Inspection Centre
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This site marks one of many temporary registration centres set up by the Kempeitai(Japanese Military Police) to screen anti-Japanese Chinese.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Upper Cross Street and South Bridge Road

properties.NAME: Kempeitai East District Branch
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The original building, the YMCA, was used by the East Branch of the Kempeitai (Japanese Military Police) during the Japanese Occupation. Local anti-Japanese suspects were imprisoned and tortured for information here. The building was pulled down in 1981
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Fort Canning Road and Orchard Road, beside YMCA

properties.NAME: Omar Kampong Malacca Mosque
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Established in 1820, Omar Kampong Malacca Mosque is Singaporecca-mosque

properties.NAME: Bukit Timah Battle
properties.DESCRIPTIO: One of the fiercest military encounters during WWII took place ere as the Bukit Timah area held strategic and tactical importance to the Japanese and the British. This site marks Percival's final defence of southern Singapore against the Japanese invader
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, near visitor centre, Bukit Timah Hill

properties.NAME: Raffles Girls' School
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Raffles Girlsb.gov.sg/places/historic-sites/raffles-girls-school
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Stamdord Road and Armenian Street, beside Lee Kong Chian School of Business, Singapore Management University

properties.NAME: Singapore Chinese Girls' School
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Singapore Chinese Girlslaces/historic-sites/singapore-chinese-girls-school

properties.NAME: Sakya Muni Buddha Gaya Temple
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Vutthisara, a monk from Thailand, founded the temple in 1927. This site is selected as both Indians and Chinese in an area predominantly settled it. It houses a Buddha statue of 15m talls and weighing 300 tonnes.

properties.NAME: Victoria Memorial Hall
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Designed by colonial engineer, John Bennett, the theatre portion of the Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall was built as a Town Hall in 1862 which housed the Municipal Offices

properties.NAME: Indian National Army Memorial
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The local INA, influenced by Subhas Chandra Bose, was formed in 1942 with Japanese support, with the aim of liberating India from British.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Queen Elizabeth Walk Esplanade Park, near Cenotaph

properties.NAME: Queen Elizabeth Walk
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This was the site of sporting activities in the early days and became popular with families. In 1953, as part of the Coronation Celebrations, the seafront promenade was refurbished and renamed Queen Elizabeth Walk.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Promenade Linking Esplanade Theatres and Queen Elizabeth Walk, Esplanade Park

properties.NAME: Japanese Propaganda Department
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Formerly housing the British Malaya Broadcasting Corporations before WWII, it was turned into a Japanese propaganda office during the Japanese Occupation. It was later also used by Lord Louis Mountbatten as the headquarters for the Japanese Surrender in
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Handy Road open space, beside The Cathay

properties.NAME: Sarimbun Beach Landing
properties.DESCRIPTIO: On 8 February 1942, Japanese forces first landed in Singapore on this beach.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Ministry of Education of Jalan Bahtera Adventure Centre

properties.NAME: Seletar Airfield
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Seletar Airfield was the British Royal Air Forcetar-airfield
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside 1 Piccadilly Circus, near Former Seletar Camp Gate, Bus Stop No. 68111

properties.NAME: Withdrawal to Singapore
properties.DESCRIPTIO: During the Second World War, the last Allied military troop in Malaya withdrew to Singapore through the Causeway on 31 January 1942, after losing Malaya to the Japanese.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: WOODLANDS WATERFRONT PARK, NEAR LAMP POST 1R-32

properties.NAME: Yeung Ching School
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Yeung Ching School began in 1905 as a private school for Cantonese children. Apart from conducting classes in the day, it offered night classes to children who were poor or overaged.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Land Parcel Beside 65 Club Street

properties.NAME: Custom House, Maxwell Road
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This was the headquarters of Singapore Customs from 1932 to 1989. The building also housed the Film Censore&w=193

properties.NAME: Deng Xiaoping
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Originally known as Deng Xiansheng and his school name Deng Xixian, Deng Xiaoping was born on 22 August 1904 in Guang'an County, Sichuan Province. In 1920, Deng left for studies in France. His six-year stay in France proved to be a turning point in his l
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Anderson Bridge, on the grounds of the Asian Civilisations Museum

properties.NAME: Anglo-Chinese School
properties.DESCRIPTIO: ACS was founded during a time where there were few schools in Singapore. On 1 March 1886, the first class commenced here at 70 Amoy Street, in a rented shophouse with only 13 students.

properties.NAME: Raffles Place
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Raffles Place was designated as Singaporees/raffles-place
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Raffles Place MRT Station, Exit A

properties.NAME: Institute of Mental Health
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The Mental Hospital was completed in 1928 at Yio Chu Kang Road. It was renamed te-of-mental-health.jpg?bc=white&w=193
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Main entrance of Buangkok Green Medical Park

properties.NAME: Gate of Hope
properties.DESCRIPTIO: From a small gate here, the compassionate sisters of the Convent of the Holy Infant Jesus took in many abandoned infants and children. A replica, named shophouse with only 13 students.

properties.NAME: United Engineers Limited
properties.DESCRIPTIO: UEL was founded in 1912. It led major construction projects that contributed to Singapore-limited.jpg?bc=white&w=193
properties.ADDRESSBUI: River Valley Road Entrance of UE Square

properties.NAME: Block A of Phoenix Park
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Block A

properties.NAME: Execution of Captured Rimau Commandos
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Operation Rimau (v.sg/places/historic-sites/execution-of-captured-rimau-commandos
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Bus Stop No. 19059, Near NUS U-town Dover Road Entrance

properties.NAME: Force 136
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Force 136 was a British secret service team that operated in Malaya during the Second World War. One of the agents was Lim Bo Seng, who led Gustavus V Operation in 1943. His grave is in the vicinity.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside zig-zag bridge to Pavailion, MacRitchie Reservoir Park

properties.NAME: Fort Canning Command Centre
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Fort Canning Command Centre was the site where Lieutenant-General Arthur Percival and his commanders decided to surrender Singapore to the Japanese on 15 February 1942.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Battlebox Entrance, Fort Canning Park

properties.NAME: Ho Chi Minh
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Anderson Bridge, on the grounds of the Asian Civilisations Museum

properties.NAME: Jawaharlal Nehru
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Anderson Bridge, on the grounds of the Asian Civilisations Museum

properties.NAME: Jose Rizal
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Anderson Bridge, on the grounds of the Asian Civilisations Museum

properties.NAME: Keppel Harbour
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Keppel Harbour has been a thriving maritime gateway for trade since the late 19th century. During the Second World War, Operation Jaywick successfully destroyed seven Japanese ships here.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Harbourfront Walk End, Promenade between Harbourfront Centre and Vivocity

properties.NAME: Lower Barracks
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Pearl's Hill and Eu Tong Sen Street, opposite Pearl's Centre

properties.NAME: Pearl's Hill School
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Pearl//www.nhb.gov.sg/places/historic-sites/pearls-hill-school

properties.NAME: Beach Road Police Station
properties.DESCRIPTIO: In the early 1900s, Singapore grew rapidly and the crime rate rose with the city's expansion. Harold Fariburn - the Inspector - General of Police from 1925 to 1935 - realised that the Police needed a programme of modernisation and expansion. As a result,

properties.NAME: People's Defence Force Camp
properties.DESCRIPTIO: In the early days of the SAF and Singapores/peoples-defence-force-headquarters
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Former Beach Road Camp, South Beach Development

properties.NAME: Sime Road Machine-Gun Pillbox
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This pillbox was located inland to provide fire cover and defence for key installations in Bukit Timah during the Second World War.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Lamp Post 32, near Singapore Island Country Club (Island Location) Entrance

properties.NAME: Pasir Panjang Machine-Gun Pillbox
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This pillbox lay within the area guarded by the 1st Battalion of the Malay Regiment during the Second World War, to protect key installations in the Southern area, such as Alexandra Military Hospital.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Pasir Panjang Road and Science Park Road, Beside Shell Petrol Station

properties.NAME: National Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Officially opened on 8 August 1963, this theatre was built to commemorate the attainment of Singapore.jpg?bc=white&w=193
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of River Valley Road and Clemnceau Avenue, Beside Fort Canning Park

properties.NAME: Singapore Polytechnic
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Established in 1954, Singapore Polytechnic is the first technical institution in Singapore to train skilled labour. The Prince Edward Campus began operations on 3 November 1958 with 2,800 students.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Bestway Building

properties.NAME: United Chinese Library
properties.DESCRIPTIO: United Chinese Library was founded by Dr Sun Yat Sen on 8 August 1910 at North Boat Quay, to spread revolutionary ideas and garner support for Dr Sunerations on 3 November 1958 with 2,800 students.

properties.NAME: Balestier Plain
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Balestier Plain was a sugar cane plantation in the early 19th century, and was used as an airfield in the 1920s. It became and continues to be a playing field for the sports clubs built around it.
properties.ADDRESSSTR: Balestier Road, Beside Bus Stop No. 50239, Near Ceylon Sports Club

properties.NAME: Jurong-Kranji Defence Line
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This is an arbitrary defence line from Kranji River to Jurong River, placed to check Japanese advance towards the city from the west.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Jurong West Neighbourhood Park

properties.NAME: Punggol Beach Massacre
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Punggol Beach was a massacre site of Sook Ching. Several men were killed by the Hojo Kempei (Japanese auxiliary military police) on this beach on 28 February 1942.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Jetty at Punggol Point Park

properties.NAME: Fuk Tak Chi
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This building housed Fuk Tak Chi (ric-sites/fuk-tak-chi
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Far East Square

properties.NAME: Adam Park
properties.DESCRIPTIO: 7 Adam Park was the headquarters of the 1st Battalion of the Cambridgeshire Regiment. From 12 to 15 February 1942, the British forces and invading Japanese troops were engaged in a fierce battle here.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Adam Road and Adam Park, near 7 Adam Park

properties.NAME: Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation
properties.DESCRIPTIO: OCBC Bank was formed in 1932 through the merger of three Hokkien banks. It was originally located at China Building which featured a prominent Chinese-style roof and classical elements on its façade.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: North Tower OCBC Headquarters

properties.NAME: Upper Seletar Reservoir
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Singaporew.nhb.gov.sg/places/historic-sites/upper-seletar-reservoir
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Lookout Tower, Upper Seletar Reservoir Park, Mandai Road Track 7

properties.NAME: Lower Peirce Reservoir
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This is Singaporev.sg/places/historic-sites/lower-peirce-reservoir
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Jetty, Lower Peirce Reservoir Park

properties.NAME: MacRitchie Reservoir
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Singaporew.nhb.gov.sg/places/historic-sites/macritchie-reservoir
properties.ADDRESSBUI: At the foot of Hilltop, Macritchie Reservoir Park

properties.NAME: United Overseas Bank
properties.DESCRIPTIO: On 1 October 1935, UOB opened for business at the Bonham Building in Raffles Place. Over the years, it grew to become one of Singaporerominent Chinese-style roof and classical elements on its façade.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: UOB Plaza One

properties.NAME: Sime Road Camp
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Sime Road Camp was the Combined Headquarters of the British Army and Air Force during the Second World War, until the headquarters relocated to Fort Canning Command Centre.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction between Adam Road and Sime Road, near Bus Stop No. 41141

properties.NAME: Kallang Airport
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This is Singaporev.sg/places/historic-sites/kallang-airport
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Junction of Kallang Airport Way and Stadium Link, beside gate to Former Kallang Airport

properties.NAME: Havelock Road Camp / River Valley Road Camp
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The area bounded by River Valley Road and Havelock Road was occupied by Prisoner-of-War (POW) camps during the Japanese Occupation. Five thousand POWs lived in dilapidated attap huts here.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside bus stop no. 13059, Valley Point Shopping Centre

properties.NAME: Clifford Pier
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Clifford Pier was the landing point for sea passengers and immigrants who came to seek a new life in Singapore. It is also known as Five thousand POWs lived in dilapidated attap huts here.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: The Fullerton Bay Hotel

properties.NAME: Singapore Badminton Hall
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Singapore Badminton Hall was built to host international badminton tournaments. In 1962, it was a vote-counting station for the Referendum on Singaporelived in dilapidated attap huts here.

properties.NAME: Katong Park
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This is one of the oldest parks in Singapore. Built in the 1930s, it was a favourite place for families and couples, with facilities such as swimming bays which extended into the sea and food outlets.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Amphitheatre at Katong Park

properties.NAME: Jalan Besar Stadium
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Jalan Besar Stadium was Singaporeoric-sites/jalan-besar-stadium
properties.ADDRESSBUI: North entrance of Jalan Besar Stadium

properties.NAME: Singapore Armed Forces Warrant Officers' and Specialists' Club
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The British Government built the clubhouse in 1951 for British non-commissioned officers. It was handed over to Singapore Government when the British pulled out in 1969.The SAF WOSE club was formed in 1974 and was formerly known as the SAF NCO Club until
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Former NCO Buildings, South Beach Development

properties.NAME: Johore Battery
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Completed in the late 1930s, Johore Battery was part of Singaporejohore_battery-37-johore-battery.jpg?bc=white&w=193
properties.ADDRESSSTR: Cosford Road, Off Upper Changi Road

properties.NAME: Merdeka Bridge
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Merdeka Bridge, declared open on 17 August 1956, was constructed to ease traffic congestion. Its name reflects Singaporee Government when the British pulled out in 1969.The SAF WOSE club was formed in 1974 and was formerly known as the SAF NCO Club until
properties.ADDRESSSTR: Merdeka Bridge, Nicoll Highway, beside lamp post 88F

properties.NAME: Silat Road Sikh Temple
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This temple was built in 1924 on Silat Road (today Jalan Bukit Merah). It was also known as the Police Gurdwara (a Sikh place of worship) as its congregation was mostly made up of Sikh policemen.

properties.NAME: The First Public Dental School and Public Clinic
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Dental Education and modern dentistry in Singapore began here in 1929. The original Clinic and Dental School of the King Edward VII college of Medicine had its beginnings on this site in the Norris Block of the General Hospital. In 1938, the clinic expan
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Link Bridge between National Dental Centre Singapore and Health Promotion Board

properties.NAME: Chen Wen Hsi
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This was formerly the home of Chen Wen Hsi, one of Singaporeites/former%20residence%20of%20chen%20wen%20his-chen-wen-hsi.jpg?bc=white&w=193

properties.NAME: Joseph Conrad
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Joseph Conrad, the renowned English master writer, was of Polish origin and travelled to Singapore and south east asia during his seafaring days. He made Singapore and Southeast asia better known to the world through his writings.
properties.ADDRESSBUI: Beside Anderson Bridge, on the grounds of the Fullerton Hotel

properties.NAME: Central Sikh Temple
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Central Sikh Temple, also known as ic-sites/central-sikh-temple
properties.ADDRESSBUI: In front of #01-234
